mapper.sql: id, stock_id, kinds, industry, status, create_date, update_date
mapper.update: update stock_my_data set stock_id = #{stockId,jdbcType=BIGINT}, kinds = #{kinds,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, industry = #{industry,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, status = #{status,jdbcType=BIT}, create_date = #{createDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, update_date = #{updateDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP} where id = #{id,jdbcType=BIGINT}
mapper.select: SELECT GROUP_CONCAT( c.selected_type SEPARATOR ',' ) selected_types, my_data.* FROM ( SELECT a.id, b. NO, b.company, a.stock_id, a.kinds, a.industry, a. STATUS, a.create_date, a.update_date FROM stock_my_data a, stock_data b WHERE a.stock_id = b.id ORDER BY b.company ASC ) my_data LEFT JOIN stock_my_selected c ON my_data.stock_id = c.stock_id and my_data.status = 1 GROUP BY my_data.stock_id

SELECT (select GROUP_CONCAT( selected_type SEPARATOR ',' ) from stock_my_selected where stock_id = a.stock_id) as selected_types, a.id, b. NO, b.company, a.stock_id, a.kinds, a.industry, a. STATUS, a.create_date, a.update_date FROM stock_my_data a, stock_data b, stock_my_selected c WHERE a.stock_id = b.id AND a.stock_id = c.stock_id AND b.status = 1 AND c.selected_type = #{type,jdbcType=BIGINT} GROUP BY a.stock_id ORDER BY c.id DESC
